libai.classifiers

Class DataSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • libai.classifiers.DataSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<DataRecord>

    public class DataSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<DataRecord>
    DataSet is a container compound by examples. Each example (or DataRecord) is a set of named attributes either discrete or continuous that represents a particular case of some type of class object. This DataSet contain methods to manipulate those DataRecord and calculate information gain, and entropy among the dataset. 
     TODO:
 - methods to read from .names/.data files
 - methods to export in format .names/.data
 - methods to read from databases tables?
 - optimizations in the sorting to avoid multiple sorting.
    Author:
    kronenthaler

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataSet

        public DataSet(int o,
       java.lang.String[] names,
       DataRecord... data_)
        Constructor. This constructor allows to create the DataRecords from unnamed attributes and setting the name positionally after the creation of the data set. Is a simplification of the next constructor.
        Parameters:
        o - the index of the attribute considered as the output.
        names - an array with the names of each attribute
        data_ - zero or more data records to build this data set.

      • DataSet

        public DataSet(int o,
       DataRecord... data_)
        Constructor. This constructor allows to create the DataRecords from named attributes. Also get some basic values used in the other methods.
        Parameters:
        o - the index of the attribute considered as the output.
        data_ - zero or more data records to build this data set.

      • DataSet

        public DataSet(DataSet src,
       int lo,
       int hi)
        Constructor. Create a data set from another data set. The new dataset will be the slice from src[lo,hi)
        Parameters:
        src - Original data set
        lo - Lower bound (inclusive)
        hi - Upper bound (exclusive)

      • sortOver

        public void sortOver(int a)
        Sort this DataSet over a particular attribute a. As the attributes are comparable, the final sorting is decided by that function.
        Parameters:
        a - column to order by

      • gain

        public double[] gain(int lo,
            int hi,
            int a)
        Calculate the absolute information gain among the elements in [lo,hi) over the attribute a. Returns an array with 4 or 6 positions (2+length(infoAvgDiscrete|infoAvgContinuous)): {absolute gain, gain ratio, values of infoAvgDiscrete|Continuous}
        Parameters:
        lo - Lower bound (inclusive)
        hi - Upper bound (exclusive)
        a - Attribute to compare.
        Returns:
        an array with absolute gain, gain ratio plus the infoAvg* values.

      • getOutputIndex

        Returns:

      • allTheSameOutput

        public boolean allTheSameOutput()
        Returns:
        true if all the DataRecords have the same output, false otherwise.

      • allTheSame

        public Attribute allTheSame()
        Check if all the DataRecord are equal in the DataSet. Return the most common output class.
        Returns:
        the most common output class if all are equal, null otherwise.

      • splitKeepingRelation

        public DataSet[] splitKeepingRelation(double proportion)
        Split this data set into two new dataset where the proportion between the output classes is kept. The first dataset contains the proportion of the original data set, for instance, if the data set has 100 elements distributed between 2 classes, in a 60/40 proportion, this first set will contain (60*proportion + 40*proportion) elements and the second data set will contain the rest. This method is useful to generate training/test sets from one massive data set.
        Parameters:
        proportion - the percentage of element to be keep of each class for the first data set.
        Returns:
        an array of 2 positions with the dataset as described above.

      • print

        public void print(java.lang.String deep)
        Print to the stderr this dataset in a human readable form.
        Parameters:
        deep - the start string to be prepend on each line.
